attributes.action: Overturn a result in favour of 'leave the EU' in the upcoming referendum
attributes.additional_details: The campaign material being used is misleading the electorate, and its use has been continued in spite of calls for clarification by, amongst others, The Office for National Statistics.  In light of the information remaining in the public domain and its likely influence on the debate the vote will be based on factually incorrect information which should have been withdrawn; the failure to do so by the leave campaign is a deliberate act to influence the vote by knowingly using misleading claims.
attributes.background: In light of the continued use, through mass media channels, by the leave campaign of what has been independently cited as misleading information in respect of the "£350m pounds a week that we could spend on the NHS if we left" I believe that a result in favour of leaving the EU would be unsound
